intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium kuhmoniemiense, commonly known as the Kuhmoniemi hawkweed, is a rare flowering plant native to Finland. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. It is known for its small size and is often found in specific microhabitats within its native range. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
